member.summary: Returns an object used to get the formatting of the and where modifications are applied to the entire .

remarks.p: Any changes made to this object will affect all the objects in the selection. So for example, the Font.Name may return "Arial" because the active cell has that as its resolved font name even though the other cells are using a different font but if you set the Font.Name of this object to "Arial" then all the objects affected by the selection will have their Font.Name updated to that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.IsInEndMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the control is in "End mode".

remarks.p: End mode is a mode that affects certain keyboard navigation such as navigating with the arrow keys. For example when in end mode and one presses the right arrow, the will be changed to be the first cell to the right of the current ActiveCell that has a value (even if the value is ""). If there were no cells to the right with a value then it would activate the right most cell in that row. End mode will end automatically such as when one presses an arrow key.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.EditModeValidationError
member.summary: Invoked when the is exiting edit mode and the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's .

remarks.p: The EditModeValidationError is raised while exiting edit mode if the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's . Since the rule needs to evaluate the value of the cell and potentially other cell's in the Worksheet, the value is first applied to the cell(s) and then is validated. By default if the event is not handled and the is true, a message box will be displayed to the end user to determine what action to take. One can handle this event and specify the action that should be taken using the .
Note: The validation rule will not be evaluated if edit mode is being cancelled such as when the user presses Escape to cancel edit.
Note: The will default to AcceptChange if the ShowErrorMessageForInvalidValue of the is false; otherwise it will default to ShowPrompt.
Note: Like Microsoft Excel, only the validation rule of the active cell is considered even if the update is affecting other cells in the selection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.Spreadsheet.OnEditModeValidationError(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetEditModeValidationErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Used to raise the event.

member.exception: The assigned value is an invalid format string and is True.
member.value: The number format string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent in units of average character widths.

remarks.p: A value of -1 indicates that the default value should be used.

member.exception: The assigned value is not -1 and is outside the valid indent level range of 0 and 250.
member.value: The indent in units of average character widths or -1 to use the default indent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

remarks.p: The Locked valid is used in Excel file only if the associated or is protected. Otherwise the value is ignored.

member.value: The valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the cell content in degrees.

remarks.p: Cell text rotation, in degrees; 0 – 90 is up 0 – 90 degrees, 91 – 180 is down 1 – 90 degrees, and 255 is vertical.

member.value: The rotation of the cell content in degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

remarks.p: If True, the size of the cell font will shrink so all data fits within the cell.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in a cell.
member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The vertical alignment of the content in a cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

remarks.p: If True, and the row associated with the cell has a default , the row's height will automatically be increased to fit wrapped content.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleSplitPanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove resizable split areas that are separately scrollable. If the worksheet currently has split areas then the splits will be removed. If the worksheet has frozen areas they will be converted to splits. Otherwise it will create split areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleFreezePanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove frozen areas. If the worksheet currently has frozen areas then they will be removed. If the worksheet currently has unfrozen splits then they will be converted to frozen splits. Otherwise it will create frozen areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstRow
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible row will be frozen at the top and the bottom area can scroll from the next row until the last row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstColumn
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible column will be frozen at the left and the right area can scroll from the next column until the last column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Removes the vertical split and sets the LeftPaneWidth of the UnfrozenPaneSettings to 0.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the width of the left row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Removes the horizontal split and sets the TopPaneHeight of the UnfrozenPaneSettings to 0.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveScrollRegionSplits
member.summary: Removes both the horizontal and vertical splits so that there is only a single scrolling region remaining.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapScrollRegionSplits
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top and left scrolling regions such that they are aligned to the edge or a row and column respectively.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.Normal
member.summary: The selection is replaced when dragging the mouse to select a cell or range of cells. Similarly when navigating via the keyboard a new selection is created. One may add a new range by holding the Ctrl key and using the mouse and one may alter the selection range containing the active cell by holding the Shift key down while clicking with the mouse or navigating with the keyboard such as with the arrow keys.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.AddToSelection
member.summary: New cell ranges are added to the without needing to hold down the ctrl key when dragging via the mouse and a range is added with the first arrow key navigation after entering the mode. One can enter the mode by pressing Shift+F8.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.RangeWorksheetCellFormatBase.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetPaneManager.BringIntoView(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetPane,Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Core.SpreadsheetCell,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Brings the specified portion of the row and/or column into view at the specified offset within the viewable area.
member.param: The pane in which to perform the scroll operation or null to use the ActivePane
The row/column that are to be brought into view.

A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the relative offset within the viewable that the column should be positioned. 0 represents the left most edge of the viewable area and 1.0 represents the right most edge of the viewable area.
A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the relative position of the cell at the specified . 0 represents the left edge of the cell and 1 represents the right edge.

A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the relative offset within the viewable that the row should be positioned. 0 represents the top most edge of the viewable area and 1.0 represents the bottom most edge of the viewable area.
A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the relative position of the cell at the specified . 0 represents the top edge of the cell and 1 represents the bottom edge.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.AllBorder

member.summary: Gets or sets the fill of the cell.
member.value: The fill of the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font formatting.

remarks.p: This font formatting is just the default font used in the cell. This can be overridden by strings on a character by character basis by using the class.

member.value: The default font formatting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.FormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the number format string.

remarks.p: For more information on excel format strings, consult Microsoft Excel help.

member.exception: The assigned value is an invalid format string and is True.
member.value: The number format string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent in units of average character widths.

remarks.p: A value of -1 indicates that the default value should be used.

member.exception: The assigned value is not -1 and is outside the valid indent level range of 0 and 250.
member.value: The indent in units of average character widths or -1 to use the default indent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

remarks.p: The Locked valid is used in Excel file only if the associated or is protected. Otherwise the value is ignored.

member.value: The valid which indicates whether the cell is locked in protected mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the cell content in degrees.

remarks.p: Cell text rotation, in degrees; 0 – 90 is up 0 – 90 degrees, 91 – 180 is down 1 – 90 degrees, and 255 is vertical.

member.value: The rotation of the cell content in degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

remarks.p: If True, the size of the cell font will shrink so all data fits within the cell.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value indicating whether the cell content will shrink to fit the cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the content in a cell.
member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The vertical alignment of the content in a cell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.WrapText
member.summary: Gets or sets the value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

remarks.p: If True, and the row associated with the cell has a default , the row's height will automatically be increased to fit wrapped content.

member.exception: The value assigned is not defined in the enumeration.
member.value: The value which indicates whether text will wrap in a cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.Normal
member.summary: The selection is replaced when dragging the mouse to select a cell or range of cells. Similarly when navigating via the keyboard a new selection is created. One may add a new range by holding the Ctrl key and using the mouse and one may alter the selection range containing the active cell by holding the Shift key down while clicking with the mouse or navigating with the keyboard such as with the arrow keys.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.ExtendSelection
member.summary: The selection range in the representing the active cell is updated as one uses the mouse to select a cell or navigating via the keyboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.AddToSelection
member.summary: New cell ranges are added to the without needing to hold down the ctrl key when dragging via the mouse and a range is added with the first arrow key navigation after entering the mode. One can enter the mode by pressing Shift+F8.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleSplitPanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove resizable split areas that are separately scrollable. If the worksheet currently has split areas then the splits will be removed. If the worksheet has frozen areas they will be converted to splits. Otherwise it will create split areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleFreezePanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove frozen areas. If the worksheet currently has frozen areas then they will be removed. If the worksheet currently has unfrozen splits then they will be converted to frozen splits. Otherwise it will create frozen areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstRow
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible row will be frozen at the top and the bottom area can scroll from the next row until the last row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstColumn
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible column will be frozen at the left and the right area can scroll from the next column until the last column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveColumnScrollRegionSplit

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapColumnScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the width of the left row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a column.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.RemoveRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Removes the horizontal split and sets the TopPaneHeight of the UnfrozenPaneSettings to 0.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapRowScrollRegionSplit
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top row scroll region such that it is aligned to the edge of a row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.SnapScrollRegionSplits
member.summary: Adjusts the height of the top and left scrolling regions such that they are aligned to the edge or a row and column respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.ActiveSelectionCellRangeFormat
member.summary: Returns an object used to get the formatting of the and where modifications are applied to the entire .

remarks.p: Any changes made to this object will affect all the objects in the selection. So for example, the Font.Name may return "Arial" because the active cell has that as its resolved font name even though the other cells are using a different font but if you set the Font.Name of this object to "Arial" then all the objects affected by the selection will have their Font.Name updated to that value.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.IsInEndMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the control is in "End mode".

remarks.p: End mode is a mode that affects certain keyboard navigation such as navigating with the arrow keys. For example when in end mode and one presses the right arrow, the will be changed to be the first cell to the right of the current ActiveCell that has a value (even if the value is ""). If there were no cells to the right with a value then it would activate the right most cell in that row. End mode will end automatically such as when one presses an arrow key.

member.summary: Returns the topmost object of a hit test for the specified
member.param: A point relative to the to hit test against.
member.returns: An object such as a or that provides information about the area associated with the specified point or null if the point is not associated with a spreadsheet item such as a cell or header.

remarks.p: Note: This method only evaluates specific information such as the positions of the rows and columns of the associated that is being displayed by the control and isn't related to other element related input hit testing such as InputHitTest or VisualTreeHelper's HitTest methods.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.OnEditModeValidationError(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEditModeValidationErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Used to invoke the event.
member.param: The data for this event.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.EditModeValidationError
member.summary: Invoked when the is exiting edit mode and the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's .

remarks.p: The EditModeValidationError is raised while exiting edit mode if the new value for the is not valid based on the criteria of that cell's . Since the rule needs to evaluate the value of the cell and potentially other cell's in the Worksheet, the value is first applied to the cell(s) and then is validated. By default if the event is not handled and the is true, a message box will be displayed to the end user to determine what action to take. One can handle this event and specify the action that should be taken using the .
Note: The validation rule will not be evaluated if edit mode is being cancelled such as when the user presses Escape to cancel edit.
Note: The will default to AcceptChange if the ShowErrorMessageForInvalidValue of the is false; otherwise it will default to ShowPrompt.
Note: Like Microsoft Excel, only the validation rule of the active cell is considered even if the update is affecting other cells in the selection.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.WorkbookDirtied
member.summary: Invoked when a change has been made to the that might require a save.

remarks.p: Note: This event is invoked asynchronously with regards to the change(s) that have occurred. Also some changes alone are not considered to dirty the Workbook even though it does change state on the Workbook or one of its subobjects. An example of that would be a zoom type operation (e.g. changing the ).
